chk 0.0.1.9006

Miscellaneous Checks

Source: R/chk-misc.R
chk_length.Rd

Miscellaneous checks.

chk_length(x, length = 1L, err = TRUE, x_name = NULL)

chk_no_missing(x, err = TRUE, x_name = NULL)

chk_unique(x, incomparables = FALSE, err = TRUE, x_name = NULL)

chk_named(x, err = TRUE, x_name = NULL)

chk_in(x, values = c(0, 1, NA), err = TRUE, x_name = NULL)

chk_match(x, regexp = ".+", err = TRUE, x_name = NULL)

Arguments

x

The object to check.
length

A count of the length.
err

A flag specifying whether to generate an error message if the check fails.
x_name

A string of the name of object x or NULL.
incomparables

A vector of values that cannot be compared. FALSE means that all values can be compared.
values

A vector of the permitted values.
regexp

A string of a regular expression.

Value

TRUE if passes check. Otherwise if throws an informative error unless err = FALSE in which case it returns FALSE.

Details

chk_length(): Check Length

Checks if is length length using:

length(x) == length

length should be a count.

Functions

  • chk_no_missing: Check No Missing Values

    Checks if no missing values using:

    !anyNA(x)

  • chk_unique: Check Unique

    Checks if unique using:

    !anyDuplicated(x, incomparables = incomparables)

  • chk_named: Check Named

    Checks if is named using:

    !is.null(names(x))

  • chk_in: Check In

    Checks if all values in values using equivalent of:

    all(match(x, values, nomatch = 0) > 0)

  • chk_match: Check Matches

    Checks if all values match regular expression using:

    all(grepl(regexp, x))

    regexp should be a non-missing character scalar.

Examples


# chk_length
try(chk_length(numeric(0)))
#> Error : `numeric(0)` must be length 1, not 0.
try(chk_length(1:2))
#> Error : `1:2` must be length 1, not 2.
chk_length(1)
#> [1] TRUE
chk_length(NA_character_)
#> [1] TRUE
chk_length(Sys.Date())
#> [1] TRUE
chk_length(Sys.time())
#> [1] TRUE
chk_length(1:2, length = 2)
#> [1] TRUE


# chk_no_missing
try(chk_no_missing(NA))
#> Error : `NA` must not have missing values.
try(chk_no_missing(c(1, NA)))
#> Error : `c(1, NA)` must not have missing values.
chk_no_missing(character(0))
#> [1] TRUE
chk_no_missing(1)
#> [1] TRUE
chk_no_missing(1:10)
#> [1] TRUE


# chk_unique
chk_unique(NULL)
#> [1] TRUE
chk_unique(numeric(0))
#> [1] TRUE
chk_unique(c(NA, 2))
#> [1] TRUE
try(chk_unique(c(NA, NA, 2)))
#> Error : `c(NA, NA, 2)` must be unique.
chk_unique(c(NA, NA, 2), incomparables = NA)
#> [1] TRUE


# chk_named
try(chk_named(1))
#> Error : `1` must be named.
try(chk_named(list(1)))
#> Error : `list(1)` must be named.
chk_named(c(x = 1))
#> [1] TRUE
chk_named(list(x = 1))
#> [1] TRUE
chk_named(c(x = 1)[-1])
#> [1] TRUE
chk_named(list(x = 1)[-1])
#> [1] TRUE


# chk_in
chk_in(numeric(0), 1:10)
#> [1] TRUE
chk_in(1, 1:10)
#> [1] TRUE
try(chk_in(11, 1:10))
#> Error : `11` must match 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 or 10, not 11.

# chk_match
try(chk_match(""))
#> Error : `""` must match regular expression '.+'.
chk_match("1")
#> [1] TRUE
try(chk_match("1", regexp = "2"))
#> Error : `"1"` must match regular expression '2'.
try(chk_match(NA_character_, regexp = ".*"))
#> Error : `NA_character_` must match regular expression '.*'.
chk_match(c("a"), regexp = ".*")
#> [1] TRUE
